availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Harmon Colley (Breathitt County, KY, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Breathitt County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Delila Colley. Father of William Colley, Elizabeth Colley, and Rachel Colley. Resident of Breathitt County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Breathitt County in 1860. Served in the 6th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from November 5, 1861, to October 14, 1862. Died from wounds received in a skirmish in Breathitt County on October 14, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Breathitt County, District 1, p. 22B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Breathitt County, District 1, p. 339.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Breathitt County, Precinct 2, p. 404B.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 062.
